      • covarianceMatrix

        public static double[][] covarianceMatrix(double[][] data,
                                          double[] means)
        Compute the covariance matrix between all column pairs (variables) in the multivariate data set
        Parameters:
        data - multivariate array of data; first index is time, second is variable number
        means - the mean of each variable (column) in the data
        Returns:
        covariance matrix

      • covarianceMatrix

        public static double[][] covarianceMatrix(double[][] data1,
                                          double[][] data2)
        Compute the covariance matrix between all column pairs (variables) in the multivariate data set, which consists of two separate multivariate vectors.
        Parameters:
        data1 - multivariate array of data; first index is time, second is variable number
        data2 - a second multivariate array of data, which can be though of as extensions of rows of the first.
        Returns:
        covariance matrix, where the columns of dat1 are numbered first, and the columns of data2 after that.

      • covarianceMatrix

        public static double[][] covarianceMatrix(double[][] data1,
                                          double[][] data2,
                                          int delay)
        Compute the covariance matrix between all column pairs (variables) in the multivariate data set, which consists of two separate multivariate vectors.
        Parameters:
        data1 - multivariate array of data; first index is time, second is variable number
        data2 - a second multivariate array of data, which can be thought of as extensions of rows of the first.
        delay - compute the lagged covariance of the given delay from data1 to data2 (assumes delay >= 0); i.e. compute correlation between data1[x] and data2[x+delay].
        Returns:
        covariance matrix, where the columns of data1 are numbered first, and the columns of data2 after that.

      • covarianceMatrix

        public static double[][] covarianceMatrix(double[][] data1,
                                          double[][] data2,
                                          double[][] data3)
        Compute the covariance matrix between all column pairs (variables) in the multivariate data set, which consists of three separate multivariate vectors.
        Parameters:
        data1 - multivariate array of data; first index is time, second is variable number
        data2 - a second multivariate array of data, which can be thought of as extensions of rows of the first.
        data2 - a third multivariate array of data, which can be thought of as extensions of rows of the first and second.
        Returns:
        covariance matrix, where the columns of data1 are numbered first, the columns of data2 after that, and finally the columns of data3.

      • covarianceTwoColumns

        public static double covarianceTwoColumns(double[][] data,
                                          int col1,
                                          int col2)

        Returns the covariance between two columns of data in a multivariate array.

        See - Mathworld

        Parameters:
        data - multivariate array of data; first index is time, second is variable number
        col1 - variable number 1 to compute the covariance to
        col2 - variable number 2 to compute the covariance to
        Returns:
        the covariance

      • covarianceTwoColumns

        public static double covarianceTwoColumns(double[][] data,
                                          int col1,
                                          int col2,
                                          double mean1,
                                          double mean2)

        Returns the covariance between two columns of data in a multivariate array.

        See - Mathworld

        Parameters:
        data - multivariate array of data; first index is time, second is variable number
        col1 - variable number 1 to compute the covariance to
        col2 - variable number 2 to compute the covariance to
        mean1 - mean of variable 1
        mean2 - mean of variable 2
        Returns:
        the covariance

      • covarianceTwoColumns

        public static double covarianceTwoColumns(double[][] data1,
                                          double[][] data2,
                                          int col1,
                                          int col2,
                                          double mean1,
                                          double mean2)

        Returns the covariance between two columns of data in two multivariate arrays.

        See - Mathworld

        Parameters:
        data1 - first multivariate array of data; first index is time, second is variable number
        data2 - second multivariate array of data; first index is time, second is variable number
        col1 - variable number 1 to compute the covariance to
        col2 - variable number 2 to compute the covariance to
        mean1 - mean of variable 1
        mean2 - mean of variable 2
        Returns:
        the covariance
